page.title: 02CONTENTIBUS LIVINGSTON
page.content: During the 1850's shale mining was the chief industry in this area. The man who brought this boom was{James {'Paraffin'Young.}The oil was extracted from the shale by burning it in a vessel called a retort. The natural black colour changed during the process to the pink we see today. The importance of{Contentibus}is that this landmark will soon disappear. The waste material is sold to W.H. Malcolm who use it as part of the foundation in road making. The waste is also used in brick making. Lothian Region Derelict Land Rehabilitation Unit are responsible for this bing and when it is level will use the land for the development of the town. At present the bing is used by motor bike scramblers. This however is an unofficial use.{
